title: Domaine du Penlois 2016 Lancié  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Lancié is one of the villages of Beaujolais-Villages, next door to Morgon and sometimes seeing itself as a Beaujolais cru in waiting. This wine certainly has structure and aging potential along with plenty of red fruits and acidity. These elements suggest that the wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine Marc Delienne 2016 Greta Carbo  (Fleurie)
description: Aged in large wooden 158- and 800-gallon barrels, this wine is rich with spice and toast flavors over the soft tannins. It has great black-fruit flavors, acidity to balance and a ripe aftertaste. The wine is smooth and can be enjoyed now but will be better from mid-2018.

title: Elio Filippino 2012 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: Underbrush, new leather, game, pipe tobacco and menthol aromas lift out of the glass. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, a hint of mint and the same gamy note as the nose alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Felsina 2015 Berardenga Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of dark culinary spice, mature berry and a whiff of new leather emerge in the glass. The tightly wound, tense palate offers wild cherry, licorice and clove framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Give this another year or two at least to fully develop. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Fram 2015 Pinotage (Citrusdal Mountain)
description: This is a surprisingly bright and herbal Pinotage, with an intense fynbos streak to the bouquet and a distinct, almost mentholated character that lifts the ripe plum, cherry and berry fruit. Framing tannins lend structure to the medium-weight palate, while notes of lightly charred black fruit and espresso unfold on the spicy close.

title: Fritz 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A shy nose belies a simplicity of green apple and fennel in this full-bodied fleshy wine that satisfies in freshness and complexity. Toasted oak marks the lengthy finish.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2014 Laurus  (Gigondas)
description: Violets and raspberries perfume this soft, pretty wine full of sun-kissed berry and cherry flavors. It's not complex, but irresistibly plush and fruity. Drink now through 2021.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Sainte-Catherine  (Gigondas)
description: Lavishly ripe blueberry and blackberry flavors penetrate through this robust yet freshly balanced red. It's a juicy, easy-drinking wine but pristine in fruit with hints of nuts and spice. The finish is softly tannic, almost powdery.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Graham cracker and vanilla wafer aromas entice on the nose. This is a ripe, dense wine which boasts a sinewy backdrop of leather among a broad expanse of rich fruit flavors. A cinnamon note lingers on the finish.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Lafayette  (Brouilly)
description: Named after the general who was so involved in American independence, this ripe and generous wine is warm with red-berry fruits and attractive acidity. It is smooth, with hints of vanilla and tangy black fruits at the end. Drink now.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine des Quartre Vents  (Fleurie)
description: This is a firm, structured wine produced at one of the many estates of Duboeuf. Rich black-cherry fruit contrasts with the dry core of the wine. Ripe and juicy, it will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Hannes Reeh 2015 Rohstoff Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Black cherry, smoke and a lick of mocha signal richness right away. The palate continues in the same vein, imbuing dark, ripe fruit with the richness of chocolate and mocha. Inherent freshness keeps this balanced. A modern, international style with an Austrian accent.

title: Heron Hill 2015 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Inviting, dense aromas of dark cherry and cranberry meet soft, sweet spice accents on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. Medium in weight, with ample roundness and structure, crunchy red-fruit flavors are bolstered by a peppered mesquite tone.

title: Holly's Hill 2016 Patriarche Blanc White (El Dorado)
description: Crisp and dry, this light-bodied wine has vivid acidity and fresh Bosc pear and white peach flavors along with a lightly astringent texture that's very appetizing. It will be just the thing as an apéritif with toasted almonds and olives. Blended from Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Picpoul and Viognier.

title: I Sodi 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Violet, black-skinned berry and vanilla scents are front and center while the concentrated, polished palate doles out juicy red cherry, cinnamon, mocha and a drop of vanilla. Fine-grained tannins provide the lithe framework. Enjoy through 2025.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This soft-textured, mouth-filling wine has woodsy, fallen leaf aromas, gentle flavors that combine savory and fruity accents and mild acidity and tannins. It's medium to full-bodied and soothing to sip.

title: Jean Loron 2016 La Victorine  (Saint-Amour)
description: An 18th-century family-owned property is the source of this crisp, textured, ripe wine. With plenty of tannins to give it structure and perfumed black fruits to convey the juicy character, it is in good shape to age a little longer. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Junta 2011 Escalera Red (Curicó Valley)
description: This blend of Carmenère, Syrah, Cab Sauvignon and Petit Verdot smells of forced oak and mint on top of standard berry scents. The palate is full and oaky but not heavy. Ripe yet racy flavors of jammy berry fruits are woody on a finish that's tannic and rubbing.

title: Kelly's Crossing 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine boasts a fruity nose of tropical and citrus notes along with white flowers and ginger spice. The acid is balanced by some fruit weight and a chalky texture, while a copper penny tang keeps things interesting.

title: Kingston Family 2016 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are on the spot and inviting, with a touch of smoky darkness. A firm, slightly clamping palate is lively and extended, while this tastes of savory, saucy plum and berry fruits. A note of ocean salt pokes through on a solid finish.

title: Kohl 2016 Kittl Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Very fresh, primary notes of green pear and apple swirl on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a savory element of chervil, celery salt and yeast to this refreshing, moreish package.

title: LangeTwins 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Full of yummy, ripe plum, boysenberry and black-pepper flavors, this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine is a great value. It's very mouth filling, soothing and delicious and has a deep color, lush and fruity aromas and soft tannins on the palate.

title: Lavau 2015 Red (Rasteau)
description: Crisp blackberry and cherry flavors are bright, but this complex wine is more about their interplay with earthier tones of smoke, game and mushroom. Rich and full on the palate yet balanced firmly with tannins and acidity, it's a stately wine with a lingering, slightly astringent chestnut finish.

title: Ledson 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a vineyard recently replanted and coming into its own, this offers dusty weavings of tobacco, clove, tar and leather, as burly and brawny as a humidor. Big-boned and ripe, the tannins are seamless on the palate and soft on the finish.

title: Lornano 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of underbrush, cedar and black-skinned berry. The chewy palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice, black pepper and coffee alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy now through 2024.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Cote Del Sol Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bolstered by a splash of co-fermented Syrah, this wine's soft and inviting nose shows black cherries, smoke, bay leaf and crushed rose petals. This bottling contains more hickory smoke seasoning than past vintages, which surrounded the red cherry and purple flower flavors. It's a great pairing for a barbecue.

title: Manoir du Carra 2016 Les Bottières  (Juliénas)
description: This is a ripe and juicy young wine. With soft tannins and bright red fruits, it is crisp while also structured. It will age further to give a generous, full-throated wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2015 Nussberg Pinot Noir (Vienna)
description: A slight hint of ripe, red cherry appears on the nose. The palate has a gentle, red-fruited freshness and a juicy generosity. A slight frame of tannins provides a gentle structure in this honest, fresh-faced and highly appetizing Pinot Noir.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sublime in texture, all smooth and velvety contours, this fruit-forward wine has a medium-bodied frame rich and ripe in white peach and vanilla. The peach turns to guava and mango as it develops additional fleshy creaminess in the glass.

title: Osprey's Dominion 2012 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Immediately appealing on the nose, this reserve offers a wealth of aromas in brandied cherry, anise, clove and savory dried meat tones. The palate works to further integrate these notes into flavors of juicy cherry, rich plum and shots of cranberry. Sultry in feel, with integrated, bolstering tannins, drink this wine through 2020 to enjoy its luscious primary flavors and developing sanguine tones.
